item.title: Over 20 games leaving PS Plus Extra, Premium next month
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/over-20-games-leaving-ps-plus-extra-premium-next-month

Batman: Arkham Knight! GTA 5! More!

A quick heads up for PlayStation Plus subscribers. Sony has updated its PS Plus Last Chance to Play section, revealing more than 20 games which will be leaving the service next month.

As of 24th April, these games are:

  • GTA 5
  • MotoGP 24
  • The Sims 4: Island Living expansion pack
  • Resistance: Fall of Man
  • Resistance 2
  • Walkabout Mini Golf
  • Synth Riders
  • Ghostbusters: Rise of the Ghost Lord
  • Before Your Eyes
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners – Chapter 2: Retribution – Payback Edition
  • Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2
  • Stranded: Alien Dawn
  • The Lego Movie 2 Video game
  • Ghostrunner
  • Payday 2: Crimewave Edition
  • Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night
  • Journey To The Savage Planet: Employee Of The Month
  • Portal Knights
  • Enter the Gungeon
  • Batman: Arkham Knight
  • Infamous: Second Son

The above titles will be removed from PS Plus in the coming weeks.

Personally, I have quite a soft spot for the Sims 4 Island Living pack. This is the one set on Sulani, and it gives Sims 4 players the chance to live out their tropical beachy dreams. Please hand me a cocktail with an umbrella in it right now. Cheers!

Another personal favourite of mine from this batch of leavers is Batman: Arkham Knight. "A confident mixture of familiar gameplay and bold storytelling brings Rocksteady's superhero trilogy to a satisfying, memorable close," reads Eurogamer's Batman: Arkham Knight review from 2015 (has it really been that long?!).

Ghostrunner, meanwhile, is a fast-paced cyberpunk action game our Bertie called a "constant joy to play".

"Ghostrunner is a game about the joy of movement, and I love how it never loses sight of that," he wrote in Eurogamer's Ghostrunner review.

As of this month, PlayStation Plus members across all subscription tiers are able to get their hands on the following three titles:

  • RoboCop: Rogue City | PS5
  • The Texas Chain Saw Massacre | PS4, PS5
  • Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth – Hacker's Memory | PS4

You can find more details on what else is on offer thanks to our full PlayStation Plus guide here.

item.title: Frostpunk 1886 is a revamped version of the original game with new content, due 2027
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/frostpunk-1886-is-a-revamped-version-of-the-original-game-with-new-content-due-2027

Developer 11 bit Studios has officially unveiled its new Frostpunk game.

It's called Frostpunk 1886, and is a revamped version of the original Frostpunk using Unreal Engine 5. However, 11 bit has said this release won't simply be a visual overhaul of the original. Rather, Frostpunk 1886 will include new content for players to discover, as well as new mechanics, laws, and an entirely new Purpose path.

The upcoming release - which is scheduled for 2027 - will also bring mod support with it, with the developer stating reimagining Frostpink in Unreal Engine "allows the game to become a living, expandable platform". That also means, future DLC is indeed a possibility.

All of this, 11 bit says, will offer up a "fresh" gameplay experience for even the "most seasoned" of Frostpunk-ers.

"The title marks the start of a new era for 11 bit studios - one focused on delivering in-house projects more frequently than ever before," the Frostpunk 1886 team said, promising more details in the coming months. Stay tuned!

You can check out the announcement trailer for Frostpunk 1886 below.

We first got word of Frostpunk 1886 earlier this month, though we didn't know its name then. Speaking with our Bertie, 11 bit CEO Przemysław Marszał teased the upcoming title, stating: "We totally believe in Frostpunk. We believe in that IP. We totally believe in that fantasy."

For more on the studio, you can find out about 11 bit's cancelled game - known as Project 8 - here.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered includes famous voice actor flub, and fans are delighted
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/oblivion-remastered-includes-famous-voice-actor-flub-and-fans-are-delighted

The long-rumoured Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion remaster released earlier this week, and fans have made a humorous yet oddly heartwarming discovery. That iconic line of an actor asking for a retake, that for some reason made it into the game's original release, is still there, alive and well in 2025.

On Oblivion Remastered's launch, Bethesda offered some clarification on why its new release is a remaster, and not a full fat remake. "We never wanted to remake it - but remaster it - where the original game was there as you remember playing it, but seen through today's technology," Bethesda wrote in a post on social media.

And, well, the studio has indeed been true to its word with the discovery that Bethesda along with co-developer Virtuos has kept the famous and really rather cherished double take voice acting mistake which has been there since the original's release in 2006.

The line in question is spoken by, rather ironically, Master Speechcraft trainer and Altmer (a race of High Elves) Tandilwe.

While Tandilwe will offer master Speechcraft training during the game - that is to say, she will help you get your influence and persuade skill up - the voice actor herself flubbed a line during recording and asked for a retake (we've all been there!).

When Tandilwe is chatting to the player about thieves being pesky buggers, the voice actress breaks character, clearly not happy with the take, and asks "wait a minute, let me do that one again", before proceeding to indeed do the line again. And, Bethesda kept it in the original game.

You can check out the original version below.

Anyway, when Oblivion Remastered was announced, fans immediately wanted that now famous line to be part of the rerelease. And, it was!

As shared on social media, "wait a minute, let me do that one again" is still there in all its glory, almost two decades later.

"This might be the most perfect remaster ever," wrote one user in a now viral X post, with accompanying footage. You can check it out below.

Oblivion Remastered kept the double take voice acting mistake that's been there since 2006

this might be the most perfect remaster ever 😭😭 pic.twitter.com/tS5kRtf59H

— Synth Potato🥔 (@SynthPotato) April 23, 2025

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Elsewhere in Elder Scrolls 4 news, there are now over 100 mods available for Oblivion Remastered, covering things like armour, weapons and HUD improvements. That's even though Bethesda has said it won't offer any official mod support.

For more, earlier this month our Jim called upon Bethesda to remake Morrowind rather than Oblivion. "You cowards," Jim wrote, calling Morrowind a "special game, where a beautifully unique fantasy setting is locked away behind technology and interface design that has aged particularly badly".
